message.content:
Below is a concise breakdown of how the target “tower” is built and which dictionary blocks (in the exact orientations shown) are used.

────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
1)  ANALYSIS OF THE MAIN TARGET IMAGE
────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
• Total Blocks = 8  
• Layering (from bottom to top):  
  – Layer 1: Three red blocks forming the base (an arch in the center, two triangular wedges on either side).  
  – Layer 2: One yellow rectangular block bridging across the base.  
  – Layer 3: Two orange cylindrical columns set on top of that yellow block.  
  – Layer 4: Another yellow rectangular block bridging across the tops of the two cylinders.  
  – Layer 5: One red triangular “roof” block perched at the very top.  

Spatially:  
• The base consists of a red arch block flanked by two red triangular wedges (left wedge, arch in center, right wedge).  
• A horizontal yellow beam rests atop this base (spanning all three base blocks).  
• Two orange cylinders stand upright on that yellow beam, supporting a second horizontal yellow beam.  
• A red triangular prism block (roof) sits on top of the upper yellow beam.  

────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
2)  SELECTING THE REQUIRED DICTIONARY BLOCKS
────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
Matching each block’s shape/color/orientation exactly (no re‐orienting allowed), the following indices are used:

• Base center arch: Block #1  
• Base left wedge: Block #13  
• Base right wedge: Block #16  
• Lower yellow beam: Block #6  
• Two orange cylinders: Block #9 (use twice)  
• Upper yellow beam: Block #6 (use again)  
• Red roof piece: Block #10  

Hence the final block‐index list is:  
[1, 13, 16, 6, 9, 9, 6, 10].  

────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
3)  ASSEMBLY ORDER
────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
Use the exact step format requested:

{
  Step1: Move block with index 13,
  Step2: Move block with index 1,
  Step3: Move block with index 16,
  Step4: Move block with index 6,
  Step5: Move block with index 9,
  Step6: Move block with index 9,
  Step7: Move block with index 6,
  Step8: Move block with index 10
}

Following these steps in order recreates the target tower exactly as shown.
